intro: Campylospermum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf campylospermum, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pink, and it produces woody蒴果. It is often found in coastal and sandy soils, adapting well to arid and saline environments.
